alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Deaf Smith; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 27 at 2:42PM CST until February 27 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHWESTERN TO SOUTH-CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM CST TUESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHWESTERN TO SOUTH-CENTRAL TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM to 8 PM CST Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Affected Area...In Texas...Oldham...Potter...Deaf Smith... Randall...Armstrong and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...For today, West-southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. For tomorrow, West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidity...For today, As low as 9 percent. For tomorrow as low as 10 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...For today, 3 to 4 with isolated 5. For tomorrow, 3 to 6. * Timing...Red Flag Warning today, noon to 8 PM. Red Flag Warning tomorrow, 10 AM through 8 PM CST.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks.

area.areaDesc: Armstrong; Deaf Smith; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall
